newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: RESEARCH ALERT - SIA upgraded - Vickers.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - SIA upgraded - Vickers.

text.p: Vickers Ballas Securities on Tuesday upgraded Singapore Airlines Ltd (SIA)to an "outperform" from "neutral" in its latest April report on the airline.

It said in its report that SIA foreign shares had been sold down from its high of Singapore $14 after the release of its interim results in October last year on concern that intense competition and higher jet fuel costs would erode margins.
"We believe that this sell-down has been overdone," said Vickers.
SIA foreign shares closed up 10 cents to S$12.10. Volume was over 1.4 million.
Passenger and cargo load factors have improved year-on-year since October 1996 to 73.5 percent and 67.5 percent respectively in February 1997.
"Furthermore, jet fuel prices have moderated to around US$25 per barrel, while the three percent fare hike in December 1996 will help alleviate downward pressure on yields," it said.
Vickers said these factors would translate to a better performance for the airline's second half ended March 31, 1997.
Vickers forecast a 1997 net profit of S$1.08 billion for the airline. Last year, SIA earnings were S$1.02 billion.
